content.description: Start up the steepest portion of the wall at a large pocket.  Bouldery moves right off the bat using a crack and knob out left and intermediate crimps to gain the 3 large huecos which are not as good as they would appear.  Larger jugs continue from here to the lip and an easy slab finish.  A wee bit sharp down low.
content.protection: 6 bolts - Second bolt is hard to clip but necessary to keep you off the slab at the bottom.
content.location: Left portion of the SW face.  Furthest route to the left on the main wall.

content.description: Start up the slightly overhanging crack with large jugs on either side.  A hard clip off of an ironically great jug leads to bouldery moves till the top of the headwall.  From here the climbing gets easier and more fun on jugs to the right of the crack.
content.location: This route is on the NW Face and is right of Monster Quest.

content.description: Head up the center of the wall on a juggy crack that overhangs for the 1st 10 feet.  Once past the lip, trend up and left along the defined slab left of the crack.  Aim for the obvious huge runnel.  Bridge back and forth keeping the bolts on your left.  This thing is juggy the whole way and stays moderate despite a decent increase in angle near the top.
content.location: Center of the wall.  Obvious huge runnel.

content.description: Up the slight bulge into a dish and water streak below the steeper headwall. Pull onto the headwall, turn the arete on the right then straight up another water streak. Juggy and and mostly vertical climbing on super positive holds.
content.location: 2nd route from the right.  Just left of Food Baby.

content.description: Pull initial overhanging moves by slapping jugs on either side of the defined rib.  As with most climbs on this crag, the start is the crux.  Once over the bulge, large jugs lead to a short steep section bridging back and forth on large features over the crack.  Once over the crack, easier climbing leads to the chains.
content.location: This is the 2nd farthest "left" or north" route on the crag.  Start just left of the obvious arching dihedral.

content.description: Start under the giant cobble of death and pull through steep opening moves on big hold and cobbles before reaching the "Death Star".  Once there mantle it and it is pretty much smooth sailing to the anchors.  This is really a 3 bolt V0 to a 3 bolt 5.8.
content.protection: 6 Bolts + Anchor.  High 1st bolt due to choss down low.  Stick clipping it is a good idea.
content.location: Middle of the crag, just left of Jesus Christ and directly under the obvious giant cobble.

content.description: As with all Scraps routes, the start is the crux. Recent feedback indicates people prefer to come in from the right of the 1st bolt then back to the left as opposed to using the flake. Work your way up past a few initial steep moves that lead to a huge hueco and jugs. From here up it is easier and fun climbing on monster jugs. Named in a Halloween theme since it was bolted and FA'd on Halloween!
content.protection: 7 bolts + anchors. A stick clip can be used as the landing zone is slightly slanted backwards with lots of exposed rock from the conglomerate. Potential for ankle-sprain-city unless you have a crash pad (have fun bush-whacking in with a pad though!).
content.location: This route is on the North face, just right of the chimney.

content.description: Start up the steep bulge passing large pockets and pinches (crux).  After 3 bolts of steepness, a short easy section allows you to rest up for the steeper headwall.  Although the angle is slightly overhanging, the holds are monster huge and cruiser to the anchors.
content.location: This route is just left of the obvious crack/runnel (Table Scraps).  From the right moving back left across the face, it is the 1st route that tackles the steep bulge.

content.description: Start up a distinct hanging rib for 2 bolts.  At the top of the rib is a ledge where you transfer onto a short steeper headwall while staying on the left side of the arete.  Once over the short section, large jugs and cruiser moves lead to the shared anchor with Cayucos.
content.location: This is the route that is the farthest to the left on the crag and is slightly left of Cayucos around the corner.

content.description: Start on the junky ramp, traverse right for a bolt then straight up the water shoot. Huge holds, fun moves. Should clean up nicely to be a good "1st time lead".
content.location: Rightmost route on the main face.

content.description: Start up the hanging pillar on huge jugs (crux).  Once over the bulge work up the super featured face above to the anchors.
content.location: 2nd to the farthest route to the "left" or North of the crag.  Start just right of the small horse looking pillar on the ground (start of Hobolicious).

content.description: Dead vert climbing up monster "Table Rock" features:  Chicken head pinches, killer cobbles, and even a cool pocket.  The start is a little chossy, but 2 moves over a little bulge and you reach big buckets and a small scoop.  Rest up, from here on up, it is vertical with great stances and large jugs with slightly smaller features connecting the "dots" which are usually huge cobbles.  Heading out right to the big crack will definitely make this climb easier.  Following the bolts up the middle of the rib was the envisioned line, but with features everywhere, the line can be rather arbitrary.
content.protection: 7 bolts + anchors.  This route had an obvious TR anchor above it, so at some point in the past this line had obvioiusly been TR'd.  You might want to stick clip the 1st bolt as it is fairly high to avoid the loose rock under the bulge.  I bouldered up to it in my tennis shoes, so I figure even people without a stick should be fine with a spot.
content.location: 3rd route from the right, just left of Soul Sister Thunder.
